required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Comparison of Two Marketed Skin Barriers on Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 4-A Clinical Comparison of a Marketed Moldable Skin Barrier Versus a Marketed Stretch-to-Fit Skin Barrier in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock:
A comparison of two skin barriers on healthy volunteers with a colostomy, ileostomy or urostomy.
Endpoints of comparison include the ability to maintain a secure fit around the stoma, skin protection, wear-time, ease of use, ease of teaching, and comfort.

detailed_description.textblock: Study to include 60 subjects, three centers, total of 4 weeks, 2 weeks in each product. Subjects recruited from a population of persons who have had an existing fecal or urinary stoma for a duration of at least three months. There is no restriction on primary diagnosis for ostomy surgery. Subjects must be of legal consenting age, must currently be managing their own stoma with a two piece pouching system, either a pre-cut, cut to fit, moldable or stretch-to-fit, any manufacturer. Subjects may not require convexity and be willing to not to use any accessory products during the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Ability to maintain secure (snug) fit around stoma
primary_outcome.description: Subject assessment of barrier fit based on questionnaire at each skin barrier change up to 2 weeks Barrier gap assessment performed by nurse at 2 weeks Barrier gap assessment performed by subject at each skin barrier change up to 2 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: SACS assessment by patient at each barrier change up to 2 weeks SACS assessment by nurse at 2 weeks
1. Assessment by subject response to questionnaire
1. Assessment by nurse of ability to teach subject to use barrier
1. Subject assessment of comfort of barrier at each change

arm_group.description: Subject will be on Surfit Moldable for 2 weeks then crossover to Formaflex
Subject will be on Formaflex for 2 weeks then crossover to Surfit Moldable

intervention.description: ConvaTec Moldable Skin Barrier for ostomy patients
Hollister skin barrier for ostomy patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Existing fecal or urinary ostomy for at least three months,consenting age, able to perform independent ostomy care, willing to not use accessory products, currently wearing a 2 piece marketed product.
- Able to participate for four weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Needing convexity.

overall_official.last_name: Ann M Durnal, RN BSN WOCN
